Dialogue:
BJ: Hello!
BS: Hello!
BJ: What do you do on your days off?
BS: I visit the library.
BJ: Do you like reading?
BS: Yes, paper books.
BJ: I haven't read much lately.
BS: Is there a library nearby?
BJ: No, there isn't. What books do you read?
BS: Practical and self-help books.
BJ: Can you suggest any?
BS: "Tsumamimeshi" for easy cooking.
BJ: What's it about?
BS: Recipes by Ryuji.
BJ: I know Ryuji from videos.
BS: His quick recipes are useful.
BJ: Is the book in the library?
BS: Yes, and other recipe books.
BJ: Is the library big?
BS: Yes, with magazines.
BJ: It's great that it's free.
BS: My library has DVDs too.
BJ: I'll check it out. Thanks.
BS: You're welcome.

BJ: Hello!  
BQ: Hello. How can I assist you today?  
BJ: What do you do on your days off?  
BQ: I typically watch subscription services.  
BJ: Like Netflix?  
BQ: Yes, I recently tried U-NEXT.  
BJ: I'm also subscribed to U-NEXT. Do you like movies?  
BQ: Yes, I enjoy them.  
BJ: Watched anything recently?  
BQ: 20th Century Boys.  
BJ: The live-action one?  
BQ: Yes, with Kenji-kun.  
BJ: I saw it when it was first released. Was it interesting?  
BQ: Yes, it was interesting enough to watch again.  
BJ: Do you prefer Japanese movies over Western ones?  
BQ: I prefer Japanese movies.  
BJ: Then U-NEXT is great because it has a lot of Japanese movies.  
BQ: It offers more titles than other subscriptions, though it's pricier.  
BJ: It can be cheaper if you share with your friends.  
BQ: I wasn't aware that was an option.  
BJ: Up to four people can share, dividing the monthly fee.  
BQ: That's good value. Can you also read magazines?  
BJ: Yes, including manga, though you mostly need points for them.  
BQ: I see. Are you subscribed to any other services?  
BJ: I am subscribed to Netflix and Amazon.  
BQ: Many people subscribe to those. I am subscribed to Disney Plus.  
BJ: There are a lot of interesting things on Disney Plus recently.  
BQ: The Baymax short film was quite good.  
BJ: Is there such a thing? I'd like to see it.  
BQ: Yes, it's available on the platform.

BJ: Hello!
BQ: Hello.
BJ: What is your favorite food?
BQ: I like tonkatsu.
BJ: I love it too. Do you prefer fillet or loin?
BQ: I like roast.
BJ: The loin is more reasonable and good.
BQ: It feels big and like a good deal.
BJ: What do you like to put on?
BQ: Sauce.
BJ: Classic choice.
BQ: What will you put on?
BJ: Sauce, but recently I've found that salt is tasty too.
BQ: Salt works quite well too.
BJ: I've only eaten it with sauce.
BQ: What do you order first at a yakiniku restaurant?
BJ: The tongue.
BQ: Many people prefer that.
BJ: Recently, I haven't been able to eat as much ribs.
BQ: The fat can be heavy. I order chicken more often.
BJ: Birds are nice too, and I like organ meats.
BQ: Are they delicious?
BJ: I like them! Preferences vary though.
BQ: Which one do you like?
BJ: Hearts and liver.
BQ: Understood.

BJ: Good evening!  
BQ: Good evening. How can I assist you tonight?  
BJ: Did you have dinner?  
BQ: I ate sushi from the supermarket for dinner.  
BJ: Sushi sounds nice.  
BQ: It was quite delicious. What did you eat?  
BJ: I had a Chinese rice bowl.  
BQ: Chinese rice bowl sounds good. Was it from a restaurant?  
BJ: No, it was instant food. It wasn't very tasty.  
BQ: That's unfortunate. Quail eggs can sometimes improve the experience.  
BJ: I like quail eggs too. There were some small ones on it.  
BQ: There are various kinds of convenient foods.  
BJ: Recently, the quality is high. Convenience stores are astonishing.  
BQ: Their product development is impressive.  
BJ: Indeed. Do you get a chance to eat it?  
BQ: Occasionally, on my days off.  
BJ: It's delicious, isn't it? I like Seven the most.  
BQ: Seven-Eleven has good options. However, they sometimes use false bottoms in their packaging.  
BJ: That's right, and recently it has become really expensive.  
BQ: Prices have increased. Sometimes the quantity decreases while the price remains the same.  
BJ: The most surprising thing was that the fried chicken stick was 180 yen.  
BQ: That is surprising.  
BJ: When I was a student, I remember it being 100 yen.  
BQ: Coffee has also gradually increased in price.  
BJ: Oh, really? I didn't know that.  
BQ: It has gone up by about 10 yen. Convenience store items are generally expensive.  
BJ: Even so, people still buy them.  
BQ: It is concerning that continuous price increases might become difficult to keep up with.  
BJ: All these price increases are really frustrating.  
BQ: It is. A price reduction seems unlikely in the near future.

BJ: Good evening!  
BQ: Good evening.  
BJ: What is the thing you want the most right now?  
BQ: I'm undecided. Should it be a car?  
BJ: Cool! Do you have a specific type in mind?  
BQ: I'm not sure. Maybe a sedan?  
BJ: Having a car can be pretty handy for a lot of things.  
BQ: That's true. Is there a car you would like to drive?  
BJ: I'd love to try a Beetle Cabriolet someday.  
BQ: I just looked it up, and it's cool. I'd like to try driving a convertible too.  
BJ: It does look nice, right? I'm not very knowledgeable about it, but I'd like to give it a go.  
BQ: I don't know much either, but it looks stylish, which is enough for me.  
BJ: Definitely! I'm not sure about things like fuel efficiency yet.  
BQ: I've heard that most modern cars are pretty fuel efficient.  
BJ: I see. It would be nice to ride one someday!  
BQ: Yes, that's right. I'll make it my goal for a while.  
BJ: That's a good idea.  
BQ: Thank you. What do you want the most right now?  
BJ: Hmm, probably money.  
BQ: It's the ultimate item that can be used for anything.  
BJ: Actually, I'm thinking about getting married.  
BQ: That's wonderful news. You must be excited!  
BJ: Thank you. But realistically, it's tough without enough money.  
BQ: Are you thinking about wedding expenses?  
BJ: Yes, and living costs for two people, among other things.  
BQ: Finding a home can be a challenge. I hope you both find the right place.  
BJ: That's right. Thanks. Married people are truly amazing.  
BQ: I'm still looking for a partner, but yes, married people are amazing.  
BJ: You'll definitely meet a wonderful partner.  
BQ: Thank you. I wish you both everlasting happiness.

BJ: Hello!
AU: Hello! How can I assist you today?
BJ: What did you do this morning?
AU: I was picking up and dropping off my daughter at cram school. What about you?
BJ: I watched a movie.
AU: Which movie did you watch?
BJ: It's called "Forrest Gump."
AU: It's well-known but I haven't seen it.
BJ: It's a classic. I've been watching classic movies I haven't seen before.
AU: Watching movies at home sounds like a good idea.
BJ: I love movies. Do you watch them often?
AU: Yes, I recently watched a show on Netflix about stigmatized properties with my child.
BJ: Was it scary?
AU: Yes, true stories make it scarier.
BJ: Horror movies are good for summer. I watched "Juso" on Netflix.
AU: I haven't seen that one. Was it good?
BJ: It's the scariest horror I've seen. Not suitable for children.
AU: Is it too intense for children?
BJ: Is it surprising? Is your child okay with scary movies?
AU: No, my child gets scared easily.
BJ: Young kids usually find those movies too much.
AU: I get scared easily, but I still want to watch horror movies. Do you have any recommendations?
BJ: Are you looking for horror or any genre?
AU: Either is fine.
BJ: Try "Orphan." It's not horror but very scary.
AU: Is it a psychological thriller?
BJ: It's very human-like and extremely interesting. I've watched it three times.
AU: That sounds intriguing.
BJ: I recommend it. Thanks for chatting!
AU: You're welcome.

BJ: Hello!  
AU: Hello!  
BJ: Do you have anyone you respect?  
AU: Someone I respect? No one in particular. How about you, do you have someone?  
BJ: I'm not sure if I can say I respect him, but I guess it's Ichiro.  
AU: Ichiro, do you also like baseball?  
BJ: I used to do it when I was in elementary school. Do you like it?  
AU: I'm not good at sports and I don't understand baseball at all. Do you go to watch baseball games?  
BJ: I see. I don't actually go to watch it in person very often. I occasionally watch the broadcast.  
AU: My father used to watch baseball broadcasts a lot at home, so I couldn't watch my favorite TV shows.  
BJ: Oh, that's something that happens often. Do you like TV?  
AU: I don't really like it, and if anything, I mostly watch videos.  
BJ: Are you referring to something like YouTube?  
AU: Netflix and YouTube are the main ones. Recently, since it's summer vacation, my kids have almost completely taken over Netflix.  
BJ: I see. Once you start watching, you can't stop, right?  
AU: That's right, and if it's a series, you keep wanting to watch more and more. Do you also watch TV dramas?  
BJ: That's why I watch dramas on Netflix! I love it.  
AU: I love American TV shows. They have an entertaining quality that allows you to watch without thinking.  
BJ: Do you have any recommendations?  
AU: Do you know the modern version of the old TV drama called "Fuller House"?  
BJ: Oh, I've only heard the name! What kind of story is it?  
AU: In the past, it was broadcast under the name "Full House." It's called a home comedy drama, right? Are you interested in that kind of thing?  
BJ: Ah, Full House! I know it, I know it. I like it. I used to watch it a lot when I was a kid.  
AU: That's it! It was fun back in the day, wasn't it? I loved that.  
BJ: There is a modern version of that, isn't there?  
AU: Yes. All the children have completely grown up. It's strange, but I watch them while remembering the old days.  
BJ: That sounds interesting. I am watching a Korean drama.  
AU: Everyone says that once you start watching Korean dramas, you get hooked! Do you have any recommendations?  
BJ: Lawyer Woo Young-woo is a genius! It's interesting!  
AU: Is it a series? I'll check it out next time.

BJ: Hello!
BL: Hello.
BJ: Is there anything you're not good at?
BL: Are you referring to food or anything in general?
BJ: Anything in general.
BL: Cockroaches.
BJ: I avoid insects and shrimp.
BL: Understood.
BJ: It's unpleasant.
BL: Acknowledged. Cockroaches have existed for millions of years.
BJ: What food don't you like?
BL: Raisins.
BJ: Appearance or taste?
BL: Texture.
BJ: Many people don't like it.
BL: Many around me can eat it.
BJ: My sister removes them from bread.
BL: Raisin bread and butter can be troublesome.
BJ: How about rum raisin ice cream?
BL: I wouldn't choose that either.
BJ: I can avoid eating raisins.
BL: Acknowledged. I rarely eat them too.
BJ: It's hard to explain why I dislike shrimp since others like it.
BL: Some dislike shrimp for different reasons.
BJ: What reasons?
BL: They say it doesn't taste good.
BJ: I like the taste, though.
BL: Preferences vary.
BJ: Yes, human taste is mysterious.
BL: Taste is indeed interesting.
